Legal_Issue: Whether the appellant fulfilled the residence requirement under Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Appellant was physically present in Canada for only 232 days over a four-year period
Promoted Canadian interests in Hong Kong
Absences due to business responsibilities in Hong Kong
Court_Ruling: Appellant did not meet the residence requirement
Defendant_Behavior: Prolonged absence from Canada for business reasons in Hong Kong
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to accumulate three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application
Legal_Standard: Residence includes physical presence, maintaining a place of abode, and intent to reside in Canada
Assessment_Factor: Duration and pattern of physical presence
Maintenance of a home in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Trial de novo before the Federal Court
Review_Standard: Reasonableness and correctness as applicable to findings of fact and law
Evidence_Used: Proof of home ownership in Canada
Application_Basis: Requirement of at least three years of residence in Canada within four years prior to application
Evidence_Assessed: Economic and professional ties to Hong Kong
Relief_Sought: Overturning the denial of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Section 5(1)(c) requires accumulation of at least three years of residence in Canada within four years preceding application, with consideration of intent and residential ties
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient demonstration of primary residential connection to Canada
Cause_Description: Appellant's application for citizenship was denied due to insufficient residence in Canada
Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed travel history, tax documents, property ownership, and business commitments
Evidence_Issues: Lack of evidence showing Canada as primary center of life
Evidence_Assessment: Appellant maintained some ties to Canada but stronger connections to Hong Kong
Decision_Rationale: The appellantâ€™s connection to Canada was not more substantial than his connection to Hong Kong; absences were not temporary
Evidentiary_Issues: Weight given to economic ties abroad versus residential ties in Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective assessment of residence based on facts indicating intent and continuity
